byline.original: By PATRICIA COHEN; Compiled by ADAM W. KEPLER

abstract: Survey released by National Endowment for the Arts finds that artists in America constitute only 1.4 percent of the nation’s work force, but are better paid than the average worker.
snippet: Artists in America constitute a tiny portion of the nation’s work force, but are better paid than the average worker, according to a survey released by the National Endowment for the Arts.
lead_paragraph: Artists in America constitute a tiny portion of the nation’s work force, but are better paid than the average worker, according to a survey released by the National Endowment for the Arts.

headline.main: Study Says Artists Have Higher Salaries
headline.print_headline: Study Says Artists Have Higher Salaries
